result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary A Bass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any other period of probation.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action on each count including a domestic abuse surcharge on each count. To pay Court appointed attorney fees due DOOR COUNTY, in an amount to be determined. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit a DNA sample and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Final court appointed atty bill from Linda Schaefer. Court approves bill.

Defendant Gary A Bass in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Cts. 3 & 4 but reads in for sentencing purposes. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court orders defendant to submit a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin and pay the DNA surcharge. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees
No contact direct or indirect with M.B. or her residence.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess any firearms.

Defendant Gary A Bass in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Gary A Bass in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Court reminds defendant of $50 per month atty fee payments. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Copy of criminal complaint put in Atty Linda Schaefer's pick up bin.
Court appoints Atty Linda Schaefer to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $50 per month toward atty fees. First payment is due by 6/30/15.
